caption.title: Timespan-corrected climate change rates.
caption.p: Rates were standardized by removing the pervasive timespan-dependent scaling trend in the compilation of continental (cont.) and oceanic data (slope=−0.90; Fig. 1) and normalizing to the mean rate at timespans between 1,000 and 2,000 years (dashed line). This timespan range represents the maximum temporal resolution likely achievable in most palaeoclimate records (see Methods and ref. 12). The normalization emphasizes how the fastest rates of geological climate change were likely attained across the Permian–Triassic boundary event (P/Tr a and P/Tr b, ∼252 Myr ago, see also Supplementary Fig. 1b).
